did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: The Great War Audio Compact Disk 1989
did.abstract: The disk, produced by Pavilion Records, contains songs of English and American soldiers, dramatized sketches, and a documentary of the gas shelling of Lille.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Great War Audio Compact Disk, 1989, in the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection, Accession #10875-ai, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the University of Virginia Library by Matthew J. Bruccoli, Bruccoli Clark Layman, Inc., Columbia, South Carolina, on July 26, 1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection consists of a digital audio compact musical disk, with an audio cassette recording copy, 1989 and ca. 1994, of "The Great War: An Evocation in Music and Drama Through Recordings Made at the Time." The compact disk was produced by Pavilion Records Ltd., Sparrows Green, Wadhurst, E. Sussex, England, and has a playing time of seventy-one minutes and thirty seconds.

Contents include: "Tipperary"/ "Keep the Home Fires Burning"/ "We Don't Want to Lose You"/ "Good-byee"/ "Over There"/"Land of Hope and Glory"/"Mademoiselle from Armentieres"/"Roses of Picardy"/"Pack up Your Troubles"/"Take Me Back to Dear Old Blighty"/Dramatized Sketches/ and Documentary Material, etc.
